column2: Morning arrived with a soft golden glow.
I woke to the sound of distant birdsong.
The curtains fluttered in the breeze.
She stirred gently beside the window.
A faint warmth touched my face.
I sat up and stretched slowly.
The wooden floor creaked beneath my feet.
He remained asleep for a moment longer.
I listened to his quiet breathing.
I made my way to the kitchen.
The kettle was already on the counter.
I poured fresh water into the kettle.
It hummed as it began to heat.
A mug sat waiting beside it.
The familiar scent of tea calmed me.
Bread was placed in the toaster.
A low click marked the start.
A cheerful tune brightened the space.
We sat at the table together.
I glanced through the open window.
A robin perched on the sill.
The tiny bird soon flew away.
We washed the dishes side by side.
Everything was returned to its place.
I checked the calendar on the wall.
Boots were fetched from the cupboard.
A gentle mist hovered above the fields.
The scent of wildflowers filled the air.
It swung open with a creak.
We walked into an open meadow.
The ground was soft beneath us.
I lay down and stared upwards.
Blue and white filled my vision.
In the distance, sheep grazed calmly.
A light breeze cooled my face.
We headed toward a small hill.
She bent to touch a petal.
At the top, the view expanded.
A river shimmered in the distance.
That sight took my breath away.
Its trunk was sturdy and rough.
The wind carried the sound away.
I peered into the water below.
On the other side, a path led home.
Boots were placed by the door.
I poured a glass of water.
Yet it had been worth it.
A book lay open on the table.
She rested her head on my shoulder.
